questions_answered.question: Steps required to file for Divorce
questions_answered.details: Steps to file a divorce
questions_answered.answer: A Divorced Petition  is to be drafted supported by  necessary documents like married Photographs, age, residence, salary proof  and other documents if any supporting affidavit .  the Petition  is to  be filed in the Court of your Jurisdiction.

questions_answered.question: Can I close my room in pagadi system?
questions_answered.details: I live in Bhandup with my dad.area is too small for me.then I bought a new house in Andheri .and I move to Andheri with my dad and stay there for few month.a few days back my landlord call me and told me u not closed ur room. u have to live there.otherwise,I will sue u and file case against u.and u lost your home. I don't understand what will I do.I need a solution for this. because he does not give me permission to take subtenant in this flat. and I also don't want to sale m flat also.
questions_answered.answer: Closing room without an appropriate reason is a ground(Non User of more than 6 months ) for eviction, you said that you  have also bought  another premises and hance created second ground( alternative Premises)  in favour of the landlord for eviction against you. Please show some most essential reason for leaving said Premises  and also not disclosing the Landlord.  Please visit premises get some evidence like electricity other bills etc., to show that u are in need of the same and your shifting is necesssary. Other wise Court will pass Order against you.

questions_answered.question: What can I do if my husband starts harassing me after dismissal?
questions_answered.details: if the court has dismissed or closed the case and husband starts harassing again what step can be taken?
questions_answered.answer: Party who is not obeying the Orders/ Judgments passed, are liable for the Contempt of Court and  be arrested.  After making an appropriate Police complaints with all the necessary Orders and Documents an application can be made in  the same Court without being filed a new matter for contempt of Court. Police Complaint be filed and protection be sought.

questions_answered.question: Is body to body massage legal in India?
questions_answered.details: Hi, I want to know if body massage from a female therapist is legal or not. What happens when caught red-handed while having a body massage from a female therapist (not prostitution) but in an illegal parlour? We would not know if the parlour is licensed or not.
questions_answered.answer:
It is legal for a female therapist to give a massage to a male client in India. However, if the massage parlour is suspected of illegal activities, authorities may raid and investigate.

If you were caught in such a parlour, it would be your responsibility to prove that no illegal act took place.

questions_answered.question: How to proceed in a cheque bounce case
questions_answered.details: can i report in police against check bounce?
questions_answered.answer: cheque bounce is criminal offence but you don't need to go to police for that, for cheque bounce you need to send notice through your advocate and give him 15 days time to pay the amount of cheque by dd or cash if the other party fails to do so than you can file court case against him within the period of 30 days after completion of 15 days time.

questions_answered.question: Complaint for fraud done by insurance company
questions_answered.details: Respected Sir /Ma'am I am an insurance agent and recently I bought a ulip for my customer and give the documents to the insurance office But when the insurance policy came to the customer home the name of insurance advisor was different, instead of mine name there was some different person. Along with this they fraudulenty sign the customer signature everywhere in the new form and mothers name was also wrongly written in the policy. So please tell me is there any legal action which I can take or should I surrender the policy.
questions_answered.answer: raise your concern with compliance department of insurance company immediately and if they are not responding properly then go for consumer complain in consumer court. you can also file fir against suspected persons in the name of your client stating that they have forged his signature.

questions_answered.question: Clarification to claim compensation under MACT Act
questions_answered.details: In nov 2014 my father died in bike accident hit by alto car in Jan 2015 I filled a case in mact case in session Court of 30 lac compensation but till not received a interim relief fund from. court what I do now 3 yeas past still not running main case related to compensation
questions_answered.answer: interim relief should not take that much time. probably your advocate might have notprassed the interim relief application , meaning thereby that your advocate might have withdrawn the interim relief application and asked the court to directly deal with main and final compensation application.

questions_answered.question: Setting aside dismiss in default order passed by court in MACP
questions_answered.details: I had filed a petition for MACP in the year 2001 but due to no appearance of me i.e claimant and my advocate it got dismissed on default on 18/12/2017 i.e 2 months back.....now my question is can i restore the same?? If yes under what section? Do i need to file delay condonation application for restoration?
questions_answered.answer: thank you for your query. yes you can get the matter restored by simply moving an application to restore the matter. mention what was the reason of your non-appearance in that application. if the court is not allowing to restore the matter then apply for certified copy of  dismissal order and file fresh complain.

questions_answered.question: Documents required to be submitted at the time of cheque bounce case
questions_answered.details: whether all the original documents must be submitted at the time of complaint u/s 138 of N.I.Act? Who is responsible for missing during the trial?
questions_answered.answer: yes, all original documents should be submitted in the court at the time of filing itself. It is advisable to submit all the documents at the time of filing itself in order to expedite the proceedings. if you want to submit it later than you can submit at the time of evidence. and once submitted, the court will be responsible for the maintenance of that documents.

questions_answered.question: My mothers property illegally transferred by my brother
questions_answered.details: My father owned a house in Patiala his whole life. He moved with me to UK around 20 years ago, leaving only my brother and my brothers wife in Patiala. Since then my brother and his wife have apparently done a fake sale of the house. They have pretended that my father has sold them the house, providing fake signature of my father. My father was not even in India when the fake deal (and fake signatures) happened. We did not know that they did this before now. We have proof (passport) that my father was in UK at the date of signature. However the date of signature is almost 15 years ago, but as mentioned, we did not know of this untill now. Can anything be done to get my fathers house back?
questions_answered.answer: yes definitely, you have right to proceed agianst them by filling both criminal and civil complaints and as per you information you have prima facie case in your favour. i advise you to proceed further go ahead to achieve your goal

questions_answered.question: How to get rid of from the case if someone filed an false FIR
questions_answered.details: We belongs to Hindu family. My brother lives in Bangluru bhabhi was also there with him from last 4 years. My parents live in Ghaziabad. questions_answered.answer: No law has been made to prosecute anyone. Even if you make two or four cases against him or you decide between you, you will be able to survive the case. You have filed a divorce case and you have filed theभ proof of the allegations If you are successful then register the complaint of the SP and district magistrate with the copy of the divorce case case.

questions_answered.question: Want to file different cases for each cheque received from same party
questions_answered.details: i have 5 cheque with same drawer of cheque so can i file 5 different cases under provisions of 138 ni act so that drawer will get harrassed and make settelment as early as possible
questions_answered.answer: Dear sir, Whether 5 cheques for one legal enforceable liability. What court see legal enforceable liability. 5 different cases will be expensive to you. Filing 5 cases does not guarantee that accused /respondent will settle.You have not stated how you got 5 cheques. You have to give legal notice within 30days of cheque bounce  and notice period is 15days to settle issues or else within 30days you have to file case/complaint against accused as per jurisdiction.Feel free to contact. Thankyou

questions_answered.question: Legal procedure to file a case of cheque bounce
questions_answered.details: Dear Sir I have been given cheque by my friend of 9 lac rupees which has bounced on 15Jan 2018. Earlier I had given a amount 7 lac to a person who was introduced to me by my friend. Now my friend has my 7 lac rupees which he is not returning beneficiary giving amount back. Can I file 138 on my friend .
questions_answered.answer: Dear sir,There is lack of some points missed out in your query.It was friendly loan what about interest?How both of you approach? Any security given? Any witness present?Loan for what any occasion; business, social function etc.The option isYou can issue notice of recovery of your amount 15days period  Wait for his reply for 15days and after that you can file complaint u/s 138 of NI Act.Notice can be drafted by you or adv. Please check NI ACT.

questions_answered.question: Can property be transferred on my name if loan was on brothers name
questions_answered.details: I hd purcsd a flat on loan 4m icici bnk. Bein abroad culd nt get a loan. So my bro took loan on his name. Flat is on his N dads name. Now i want to pay up d bal n clear. He says.. bank has said to give NOC from all 3 bro as fathers name is involvd. Cant he transfer the flat in my name with the loan or after i pay d bal without an NOC. Kindly advice.
questions_answered.answer: Reply to your query:-At the outset contradictory statement that you had purchased a flat on loan from ICICI Bank, but being abroad could not get a loan.Your brother applied for loan(nothing clear hence, home loan) on behalf of you by putting his name first as he applied loan (actually on your behalf)   which was duly sanctioned and your daddy's name.You have total 2 brothers (in other words your father having 3 sons)-you have not mentioned that whether you were re-reimbursing the entire loan installments amount to(monthly EMI) to your brother.,monthly basis or not.Bank is not aware about your internal arrangements of funds so bank is right that bring NOC from all the sons/legal heirs /representatives of your father..Your brother can not transfer the flat in your name since your father name also been inserted hence, even though it is your flat purchased on behalf of you by your brother, the NOC procedure must.You have to provide documentary/monetary evidence that although your brother name is in sale-deed and also in share certificate it is your money only and you are buyer of the flat, It is undisputed fact that you have to pay entire amount of loan+ interest and bank charges + out of pocket expenses+ registration fees etc to  your brother.whether have made any MOU or understanding documents/ affidavit/ whether power of attorney made by you to your brother. relinquishment deed to be prepare for giving away/surrendering his right since on paper your brother is owner(co-owner).Even your brother NOC is must and for that you need to pay all his dues first with MOU that once he receive entire amount he will be binding to issue NOC to you.Without NOC share certificate will not be in your name.+ you need to make one gift deed your father giving his right/ share in the said flat to you in your name.- hidden part since your father name is also mentioned in share certificate. -Father gift to son nominal expenses. Try to finish the procedure as soon as possible if any thing adverse / against you then you may face litigation as bank and society knows your brother and your father as shareholder. Hope its clear . however need to check the documents also hence, primafacie this is opinion. Thank you

questions_answered.question: Clarification on nominees name added in share certificate
questions_answered.details: Flat in joint names of wife and husband. Husband died in 2012. Society received request for endorsing 2 Nominees' names on reverse of share certificate as nominee wanted to apply for mortgage loan. After consulting lawyer society entered the names of nominees by mentioning the word "Nominees" alongside in bracket. Is this correct? Though wife is still alive the Nominee is harassing society to transfer share certificate in his sole name. Clarity required.
questions_answered.answer: As mentioned first line flat is in joint names of wife and husband(if not mentioned it is understood 50% ratio of each) now as Husband expired in the year 2012. so the society should have been deleted the name of husband and wife name should have been mentioned only on share certificate as wife is co-owner of the flat. now if the society have already endorsed 2 nominees name on reverse of share certificate as nominee, when the co-owner is alive nominee do not have any right in the share/property/flat till owner (co-owner is alive) the society in fact should not have to mention the 2 nomiees name in share certificate, nomination(nominee) name can be anytime withdrawn as nominee-big mistake society did-what if the nomiee changed? nominee expired? nominee can not act by virtue of whatsoever any reason?. in stead of that society can mention the names of nominee in the nomination register, nomination file.right now wife is the sole owner of the flat till she dies after her death only question arises what to do next. whether the society has asked family tree of husband and wife? whether 2 nominees are the only heirs of husband and wife?In nut shell, nominee can not harass the society to transfer the share certificate in his sole name, because nominee do not have any locus standi to ask for or to speak/communicate with the society, for further clarification documents need to be check.

questions_answered.question: Property sold by a father without permission during the minor years raises concerns.

questions_answered.question: Revoking of settlement of house property by the executor

She settled the property without getting consent of other children. Hindu religion.
questions_answered.answer: First of all,  there is no need to get consent from other children for settling her property among one son. Also cancellation of settlement deed is possible based on the conditions mentioned. If irrevocable settlement, then explore other options

questions_answered.question: Can son's wife claim rights over his property if he passes away
questions_answered.details: Father gives his flat through settlement deed to mother. Mother passes away without will. Ownership of the flat goes to father and two sons at 1/3 each. What if one of the sons pass away before the father. Does the deceased son's wife get 1/3 share?
questions_answered.answer: Definely wife and children if any, will get a share in the property even if it is jointly owned. But, share will vary according to Muslim law and Hindu succession Act and again father will get a share in sons property if son pre deceases.

questions_answered.question: Person having possession of property for 20 years claims ownership
questions_answered.details: A person lives in other's place(registered)...and pays house tax ,EB bill and other taxes in his name for about 20 years.... And then gets a patta for the land in his name... Is it legal?....Can the patta be challenged?or cancelled?
questions_answered.answer: Nobody can take possession of others property by occupation and by paying tax. But in your case, it is bit confusing as how can the occupant pay tax in his name if the property is in your name and no details about rent.

questions_answered.question: Can gift be made to 2 out of 7 sons from ancestral property
questions_answered.details: i iave 7 sons and can i make a gift to 2 sons from ancestral property
questions_answered.answer: Ancestral property can be divided equally by all legal heirs. Gifting to two sons out of 7 will end up in legal complications at a later stage unless all 5 relinquish their right of share in favour of 2.

questions_answered.question: Can a public servant pass order without obtaining approval
questions_answered.details: In case an 'Order' is issued by any Public Servant without obtaining requisite appropriate approval, as mandated by Authorised Manuals for such activity, will; 1) Such an Order be considered as faulty and defective. 2) Can any action be taken on the basis of such an Order 3) In case such an Order is challenged in the court of law will that Order be termed as bad in law. Elaboration of the Query: For example say a multi member Executive Committee in a public sector organization is the appropriate authority to terminate a contract. In case the termination order is issued on the basis of approval by an individual officer of a lower rank who is not even a member of such authorized executive committee what will be the status of such termination order with respect to the 3 queries raised above.
questions_answered.answer: Yes, if any order is passed without having any authority, the same is bad in law, inoperative and always challangable before the Court law. Also, the officer who passed the order, is liable to be prosecuted of a departmental enquiry.

questions_answered.question: Procedure to retire and also to add a partner in partnership firm
questions_answered.details: I would like to retire one partner and add other partner in partnership firm having currently 2 partners. on how much stamp paper this should be made and also in case of loss of original deed (photocopy available) what should be done to have other copy of original deed
questions_answered.answer: Stamp duty defers state to state. You are requested to kindly let us know the name of state where you executed the partnership deed. First you have to execute a deed for retirement of the partner and then deed for adding the new partner ..

questions_answered.question: Can the hearing of different cases be  scheduled on the same day
questions_answered.details: Meri patni apni man marji se apne mayke chali gayi thi aur aane ko taiyar nahi thi tab maine usko rakhne ke liye( HMA act section 9 ) lagaya to Meri patni ne mujh par 498a, gharelu hinsa aur ipc 125 mantinance ke jhunthe case laga Diye hai. Lekin in cases ki tarikhen 15-15 din ki lag rahi hai is hisaab se ek mahine me 7-8 tarikhen lag jati hai. But mujhe yah problem hai ki mai Delhi me ek private company me 8000 rupay me kaam karta hun jis Karan se mai case fight nahi kar pa Raha hun. Kyonki Delhi se 500km door har mahine me 3-4 baar tarikhon me Jana padta hai, jisse samay ka, rupay ka aur naukari se nikaale jaane ki pareshani hoti hai. Mujhe koi upay batayen ki in 3-4 cases ki sunwai ek hi tareekh par kaise karayi Jaye .
questions_answered.answer: You please contact your lawyer suggesting to get hearing date on specified date only. Your lawyer has to convey your pain and inconvenience to the Court. Also your lawyer may inform the court about your poor financial conditions.

questions_answered.question: Is it possible to ask refund for the days I have not stayed in hostel
questions_answered.details: I took admission in NIT Jamshedpur for MSc course ( academic year 2017-18) but within one month of the starting of the classes, I got an opportunity to get admitted into Hyderabad Central university ( the entrance exams & counseling process for both the institutes are different ). So, I left NIT Jamshedpur and after much request, they have refunded just the Caution money. I wish to get the refund of my - i) academic fee ( with some deduction, of course ) ; ii) my hostel security fee ; iii) my hostel fee ( after deduction as per my number of days of stay ) . Please suggest if it is legally possible, and if yes, what route should I take ? Thanks.
questions_answered.answer: It depends upon the rules framed by the Institute. Also, You may not have a right to get refund of academic fee except caution money, because you occupied a seat and thereafter vacant due to which the Institute has to make an exercis of new admission or probably they may not get.

questions_answered.question: In brief, I was cheated by girl in a matrimonial website.she put up fake pictures and fake informati
questions_answered.details: In brief, I was cheated by girl in a matrimonial website.she put up fake pictures and fake information and got me trapped emotionally into her sob story of critically ill father being treated under ICU. I ended up with transferring my hard-earned money to her to her her father, without even meeting her.. After 6 months, when I got to know her truth, she came to meet me for the first time and promised me to return the money. 2 months passed by and she failed to return my money, when I approached the police. After 6-month struggle, I got FIR lodged. She filed anticipatory bail in session and high court, which got rejected immediately. After that her family approached me to settle the case for nothing but to buy time before she could get arrested and get out in 15days on medical ground. My lawyer didn't try to make it conditional bail. Now the case is pending in Andheri court. I want to know what are the options I have to recover the money. First transfer I had made was in August 2017.
questions_answered.answer: Now first up all you file recovery suit and in such suit make party his father also and before that search that they have any immovable or movable property. if they have property the file a suit and in such suit file an application for attachment before judgement such property. If you file such recovery suit and file an application for attachment they give your money suddenly. And also take copy of bail order and challenge or file an application for breach of condition and for that cancellation of bail.and also file an application for cancellation of bail that she taken conditional bail on wrongfullgrond.

questions_answered.question: Married man having physical relation & love with girl & girl knows & no promise of marriage but girl
questions_answered.details: Hi my brother in law is 31 & has a daughter. He had physical relation & affair with UNMARRIED 26 yr old colleague of his wife for last 3 years. Without knowledge of wife but the girl knew he’s married & he didn’t promise marriage. But he said he loves her & he is bored of his wife but cannot leave her. Now the girl wants to marry. Can the girl claim marriage rights & do case? Can my brother in law put harassment case on the girl? Can my sister make case on her husband & also on the girl for cheating & still not give divorce? What sections would apply? All Hindus by religion.
questions_answered.answer: Answer for 1st question. that the girl can claim for marriage rights, then yes and she has right to file case.second question. that your brother in law also right to file case for harassment. In all such situation your sister has vast rights she can file domestic violence case, maintenance case, and also file cheating case with section 498 of IPC and also 420 on such girl.

questions_answered.question: Criminal case FIR ipc sec 323;326,34,
questions_answered.details: Sir, my family include me involve by a false case of 326 my case status is disposed we not spent a min in jail nether lockup complainer tell they will take there case after 3 month i am not convicted will my past trouble be effect in my C1D visa in future help me out sir pls.
questions_answered.answer: no, you don't have any problem about your Visa. because you are not convicted means you are acquitted from the offence. so nothing any problem and don't take any tension.And most important things that you collect the judgement copy with certified by court two or three copies and one of them copy given in certain police station and one of superintendent of police office or commissioner of police office. And taken o/c from such offices. for verification. And also to record it in your crime. If kn future any issue arises then such  copies will help you.

questions_answered.question: Can I get implicated in a case of abetment to suicide if a girl commits suicide in love ?
questions_answered.details: sir, i was in a relationship with a girl for 5 years. there were always fights on silly topics and she never trusted me and the fights continued for days. finally i could not have any hope and asked her for a break up which she refused. so i decided to cut my relationship with her and move on. after 6 months i met another girl and fell into a relationship. after some months the 1st girl knew about my present situation and is continuously harassing me. i just fear that she may harm herself though she denies of doing that. my question is that if you break up with someone and they kill themselves india then can i be implicated for abetment? will there be any legal issue? kindly help me, thanking you.
questions_answered.answer: Mere relationship is not sufficient to entitle a girl to sue a boy. It depends upon nature of your relationship. If the relationship was a live in like that of a husband and wife the girl can sue you under Domestic Violence Act wherein she can enforce right to residence and maintenance.Similarly, if you have maintained physical relationship with the girl with promise to marry than also you will be liable for prosecution for cheating and false promises to marry as per IPC. Your apprehension that what will happen if she commits suicide. It depends upon circumstances and you may be impressed for abetment too but again I am saying that other circumstances will also be looked into in such situation

questions_answered.question: What is the purpose of summon in case of FIR made for theft
questions_answered.details: In year 2014, there was a theft in my house. we lodged a F.I.R in police station. we did not get back our belongings at that time. now today we got summons to witness from court.please let me know what is the meaning of this summon and why is this sent to us now...what to do?
questions_answered.answer: Oh it means the investigating agencies ie  police has submitted its final report before the designated competent court in its jurisdiction. Generally if the investigating agencies do not find ample evidence against a perpetrator of crime they submit final form before the court to close the evidence  After receiving such report the competent designated court issues notice to informant to appear before it and if the informant represents it with reason why he is dissatisfied with investigation the court after hearing may direct further investigation or it may accept the report bring an end to case.

questions_answered.question: Clarification regarding the court fees for property matter
questions_answered.details: how much court fee do i have to pay for my civil case on land value of 5000000 and 1600000 ?
questions_answered.answer: According to Schedule 1 of Court Fees Act you have to pay Court fee worth Rs. 2679.25ps. for 1st. Rs.50000/- and thereafter for every Rs.5000/- or part thereof you have to pay Rs 150/-.On such calculations you have to pay Rs 5579.25ps in all. But calculations differs according to prayer. For certain type of suit there is fixed court fees prescribed by law for example for a suit for partition or for simple declaration and so also if your suit of such nature where its value can't be ascertained etc. So while asking for quantum of court fees payable you must disclose what type of suit do you intend to initiate.

questions_answered.question: Obstruction of municipality drain by a neighbour
questions_answered.details: Sir, My neighbour obstruct the Municipality drain, so my domestic sewerage could not be disposed into the drain and accumulated in my house. Therefore pl. advise what should I do?
questions_answered.answer: You initiate a proceeding U/s 133 of Cr.p.c. in the court of Executive Magistrate of your jurisdiction who has authority to direct for removal of obstruction in public property. Similarly, since it is  a nuisance causing hazard to public health you can initiate a criminal proceeding by lodging FIR before the police.

questions_answered.question: Can a married daughter claim money from father exgratia payment
questions_answered.details: we have received exgrtia amount in 2017.The land sold on 1996.can married daughter claim share of EXGRATIA payment?
questions_answered.answer: No, She can't claim maintenance. However a married daughter being included as a coparcener u/s 6 of Hindu Sccession Act as amended in the year 2005 a daughter either married or unmarried has now a right to claim partition like that of a son.

questions_answered.question: Is Airbnb legal in residential areas of India?
questions_answered.details: Hi, I am planning to list my residential property on Airbnb. Is Airbnb legal in India? Are airbnb legal in residential areas? the society management committee is not approving citing the use of residential areas as commercial use. Please advise on how to tackle this as MC members have requested me to explain under what law I can list my property on Airbnb. Need help to draft appropriate application to society MC.
questions_answered.answer: Dear sirexcuse me sir ! As per society act according commercial activities not allow under residential flat but only allow for some professional like advocate, Dr. Yoga teacher. in your case ,you want to listing residential property on Airbnb for give rent purpose for short time so not allowed as per act so society management committee is not approving citing the use of residential area as commercial use.  if you give rent minimum 11 moth or more then period ,you take lawfully approval from society.Thanks & Regard,Vivek Srivastava

questions_answered.question: How to remove mother in law's name from co-ownership of flat
questions_answered.details: Hi My Husband owns a joined flat with my mother in law. The loan has been paid off completely by my Husband and we have received the documents from the bank. Pls advise the process required to delete my Mother in law’s name as the co-owner from the agreement. What would be the approx charges required? Also at the same time, can my name be added simultaneously while deleting hers. She is willing to sign the no objection documents. Pls advise.
questions_answered.answer: Hi,There are a number of ways in which your aim could be achieve. First option, you get an NOC from the society afterthat you can do the easiest way to remove your Mother in law’s name from the joint names as the co-owner from the agreement. if you do execute a release deed or relinquishment deed in favour of your name. Your Mother in law’s name as the first party execute the release or relinquishment deed in favour of you the second party and the document should be properly stamped and registered in jurisdictional sub-registrar office .In the alternative option your Mother in law’s can execute gift deed in your favour. it would attract 2% stamp duty on market value of property as per Ready Reckoner rates. The process, amount of stamp duty or taxes will depend upon the State where the property is situated. You will not have to worry as the gift deed is the safe and less expensive in terms of stamp duty.Thus from a stamp duty perspective, it is advisable to execute a gift deed rather than a release deed or relinquishment deed and the option you choose out of the two given here. You can consult a property lawyer on your states or contact us for further process...Thnaks & Regards,Vivek srivastava

questions_answered.question: Can i claim ownership of land i have used for 20 years in india ?
questions_answered.details: I got a property in my name, but due to my work, I have had to move from one place to another for years, so I haven't visited my property for a long time. However, I pay all land taxes regularly by myself. On the said property, my aunty and her children have been living for the last 20 years. Can someone claim your property if they maintain it? Can I claim ownership of land I have used for 20 years in India?
questions_answered.answer: No, sir, they cannot claim ownership based solely on possession. Please note that the recent judgment of the Hon'ble Supreme Court has clarified that a person in possession of a property cannot claim ownership based on adverse possession unless specific legal conditions are met. — Ajit Kumar, Advocate.

questions_answered.question: Decided cases on rights of the woman in their  matrimonial homes
questions_answered.details: My sister is facing a problem at her matrimonial house.. District court judge has asked us to give any judgement from supreme court or high court where they have said that daughter-in-law can reside with parents-in-law at seperate floors in same shared household under section 17. If anyone can provide the decided cases by supreme court or High courts in this regard it will be great help.
questions_answered.answer: To,						   Dated :06.09.2017 Dear Madam, Sub: 	Legal opinion regarding the query dated 06.09.2017.Dear Madam, 	As per the following judgment, you can reside with parents in law at separate floor in same shared household under section 17 of Domestic Violence Act. 1.	Navneet Arora Versus Surender Kaur & Ors. 2015 III AD  (Delhi) 337.2.	Nidhi Kumar Gandhi versus State of others 157 (2009) Delhi Law Times 472.3.	Shambhu Prasad Singh Versus Manjari  190 (2012) Delhi Law Time 647 (DB) 4.	S.R. Batra & Ors. Versus Tarun Batra AIR 2007 SC 1118. 5.	Preeti Satija Versus Raj Kumar & Others 2007 (2014) Delhi Law Times 78 (DB). 	It is further submit that as per the conclusion of the all judgments you can reside with parents in law a separate floor share household under section 17 of Domestic Violence Act. Except the following conditions:-1.	Section 17, 19 of Domestic Violence Act, right of the estranged wife against the husband, not against the father in law, or other relatives mother in law. 2.	question property cannot be called shared household. 3.	Right to alternative accommodation claim can be made to husband only. 4.	If the property is joint family, you can enjoy the section 17 of the D.V. Act5.	Property must be joint family as well as belong to the husband. This is my legal opinion. Copy kept. With regard. Regards

questions_answered.question: How to file for maintenance on the grounds of dessertion by husband
questions_answered.details: I'm 32years female and having a kid of 4.6yrs. My husband left me 4yrs ago and not interested to continue our marriage relationship. He is having multiple relationships with other girls. He is not paying any maintenance to me and my kid till date. Now I want to proceed legally to complete this issue. Kindly suggest what all documents are required to file a maintenance case as I'm a dependent on my parent's and living with them. How to proceed?
questions_answered.answer: To,						Dated :11.09.2017 Dear Madam, Sub: 	Legal opinion regarding the query dated 07.09.2017.Dear Madam, 	The provision of Section 9,10,13 14, 23, 24 and 25 of HMA Acts 1955 and old section 488 Cr.P.C. (New Section 125 Cr.P.C.) constitute one system of law and part of a single scheme or of the same  legislative plan (Sadhu Ram Versus Nathu Dass AIR 1961 Punjab 191).That you can file petition under section 125 Cr.P.C. for maintenance against your husband/Respondent. In this Section 125 Cr.P.C. if your husband/Respondent has sufficient means neglect or refuse to maintenance:-a).	You are, unable to maintain yourself orb).	Your legitimate or illegitimate minor child whether married not unable to maintain itself.c).	Your  legitimate or illegitimate child (not being a married daughter) who has attained majority, where such child is, by reason of any physical or mental abnormality or injury unable to maintain itself, or. d).	Your father or mother, unable to maintain himself  or herself. 	That section 126 of Cr.P.C. provide the procedure for the maintenance. You can file the petition U/s 125 Cr.P.C. taken against your husband in any District:-a).	Where he is, or b).	Where he is or your are resides, or c).	Where he last reside with you or as the case may be with the mother of the legitimate child. 	It also submit that we are agree as on your terms and conditions as per the professional visit dated Nil. It is further submit that we have to requires the following documents for court proceeding as well as further proceedings:-1.	Signed Vakalatnama 2.	4 Marriage photographs of Petitioner and Respondents (Postcard Size)3.	6 Passport size photographs of Petitioner.4.	4 passport size photographs of the children of the Petitioner. 5.	Marriage Card or any marriage proof, If any.6.	I.D. proof of the Petitioner and her childrens. 	(Aadhar Card/DL/Passport/Voter I.D./ Date of birth certificate, school I.D. card etc.) if any. 	 7.	Any criminal and civil complaint pending before appropriate authority, if any. 8.	Income proof the spouse/husband as Respondents. 9.	Any relevant documents/correspondence/ proof relevant incident, if any.  10.	You can also brief day to day incident from the date of marriage. KINDLY TAKE NECESSARY/URGENT ACTION.Copy kept. With regard. Regards

questions_answered.question: what to do if company is not giving salary slip?
questions_answered.details: I am working in a company from last 3yrs . I applied for a loan and asked for a salary slip but director refused it giving some bogus reasons. what to do when salary slip not provided by employer?
questions_answered.answer: As per the below mentioned rules the pay slip forms a legal mandatory requirment. Here it has to be distributed to the employees with their and employer's /representatives signature. ((Minimum Wage (Central) Rules, 1950, Rule 26(4) and Minimum Wage (Central) Rules, 1950, Rule 26(3)) And the employees should be aware of the contents of the pay slip. And even if it is transferred to the bank, there should be an authenticated record stating that the employee is willing to get his/her salary transferred to bank. If the assessee doesn't provide the salary slip or a document evidencing the total salary paid to an employee, then he shall be violating Rule 26A and Rule 31 of the Income-tax Rules 1962. Further, non-issuance of Form 16 under 203 shall be liable for penalty at the rate Rs 100 each day under Section 272A. So, you may bring this fact to the notice  of the director

questions_answered.question: Employee absconding from company but still receiving salary
questions_answered.details: i am an ex employee of Barclays plc noida and i got absconded on 08th jan 18 due to immediate joining in different company and still i had been credited with jan and feb month salary from barclays. Will there be any complication if i don't inform them??
questions_answered.answer: Yes surely you are  going to be in trouble.  Barclays paid you salary wrongly and since you have been absconding from your duties you have lost all rights to receive salary.  You are advised to return the salary wrongly received for the whole time period you have not worked. Further you are advised   to send apology letter and fulfil all the terms and conditions of the letter of appointment. Failing  which you can be charged with offences under IPC and labour laws.

questions_answered.question: Want to file case against manager for creating issue in rejoining
questions_answered.details: I want to re-join my previous organization. but my manager done my re-hiring status is NO, I worked there 3 years without any illegal action. I was left job with 45 days of notice period as per company policy and region reason was better opportunity. as per company policy if u want to region with 45 days of notice period then u can re-join again if employee want in future and there are lot of hiring in my pervious organization but I can not re-join due to my previous manager done my re-hiring status is No due to jealousy. that's why I want to file case against my manager. please help me asap.
questions_answered.answer: Terms of the contract of employment have to be referred to. You have been properly relieved after tendering your resignation. To re-join a  company, it is at the sole wish of the employer.  The good past record at the previous employer can  help you but  re-employment shall be at the sole discretion of the employer. Further your plea that  substantial hiring is going on may not help you as you have not been retrenched from the employment.  i suggest you meet  the  authority next to your manager, who may help .

questions_answered.question: What remedies against false DV and divorce case
questions_answered.details: I am facing false cases of DV and divorce. I have received wife application in DV and I have to file say. She mentioned she is jobless in her application. She is MBA and I have her recent PF statement via RTI which valid proof that she is working and lied in application. There are other such lies as well in application. questions_answered.question: Divorce by Mutual Consent.....................
questions_answered.details: We got married in Nov 2013. I am a Sikh my husband is a Hindu. We stayed together in Pune until Feb 2015, but had lot of mutual arguments and fights even during that period. After that, he moved to Mumbai for a job. He used to visit Pune on weekends but our fights and arguments did not resolve. Since October 2016, his visits reduced further as we could not stay together and we have not met at all since Feb 2017. We want to file a divorce by mutual consent. Can we file it immediately since we have not been staying together and only been meeting to see if we can resolve things. What will be the total charges including lawyer and court? We do not have any joint account, property or children together. Is there a way to initiate the process online?
questions_answered.answer: Petition can't be filed online. You can file mutual consent divorce petition right away. After filling of petition six months cooling period is there to change your decision. After six months if you both persists with divorce then decree of divorce will be passed. There's no Court fee as such but lawyers fee will differ.

questions_answered.details: Can i send the notice if the memo date is 13/6 and cheque issue date is 18/03/19 does it compulsory that cheque should be valid or 30 days from bank memo
questions_answered.answer: kindly note that legal notice should be served within 30 days through Registered Post A.D. from the date of dishonor of cheque. After receipt of of legal notice and failure to pay within 15 days complaint can be filed before concerned JMFC court within a period of 30 days.

questions_answered.question: Cheated by Builder & developer
questions_answered.details: Hi, I have been cheated by Builder&developer in Mumbai. I have purchased a land from private builder & developer & have paid him partial amt as agreed. No reg or sale is deed done only agreement is done but have all proof of payment such as bank st&receipt. But since he was not doing any development work I stop paying pending amount. Since then I have tried many time seeking my refund or land which possible but no reply from him. He has given lot of false promise. Then he stopped answer call/sms, blocked me on whatsap. He has also rented his office to some1 else. Then I have approached consumer court & got all my documents submitted but he is not submitting his response to court against my submission & taking new dates. Everytime he buys time & I get next 4 mths dates & already 1.6+ yrs have passed by. Please let me know what alternative options I have to nail him, Can I file police complain in parallel. Is there anyway possible to fast track my case. Or no options for me.
questions_answered.answer: You can approach the police authority and file a complaint for cheating.  simultaneously,  proceeding can be initiated by filing complaint before competent consumer forum for compensation. You can add the bank as a party in the consumer forum proceedings in case if you have obtained loan from any bank.

questions_answered.question: cheque dishoniured  - way to recover funds
questions_answered.details: sir,nowadays lots of people dishonour cheques & are than avoiding to get it cleared... pls suggest a way or explain what's the law for cheque dishonour ???
questions_answered.answer: Legal notice through should be served within 30 days from the date of dishonour of cheque.After the expiry of 15 days from service of notice complaint can be filed before competent court if the cheque is not honored even after service of notice.

questions_answered.question: convicted in cheque bounce case
questions_answered.details: hello sir,  i am resident of maharashtra, got convicted in 138 case with 2 years and double the cheque amount that is 1614000/-.... i appealed in session court with order to pay 50% of compensation in 1 month... i just wanted to take an advice that is my case with merit or shall i try to make settlement with opposite party? i would like to send my case points so that you may understand the situation...
questions_answered.answer: you can challenge the order of the sessions court if you are hopeful to succeed in proving that there was no legally enforceable debt or you can settle the same by depositing certain amount before the appellate court.

questions_answered.answer: This is not related to a lawyer. Wrong place or this question. You can check passport website or all this information where you will get all the answer or search the google for this question. An affidavit will be required for this.

questions_answered.question: How to legally add co-applicant in loan
questions_answered.details: Me and my brother purchased flat in Ahmadabad. For this property me and my wife are co-applicant in home loan and co-owner as well in sell deed because for some reason I can't add my brother as co-applicant. Loan installments will be paid by me and my brother in share of 50:50. Now how to do any legal document stating that me and my brother having ownership of 50:50 not between me and my wife.
questions_answered.answer: That you need to execute and register Release deed for transfer of Half share in property in question or to obtain order from court for the said purpose because simply putting in writing in MOU or agreement do not solve the purpose. You need registered documents in  your and your brother name. That loan is a separate matter at the discretion of bank subsequently you can add name of your brother also in bank record after transfer of property. But before doing the same you need to see whether any person from Bank is necessary since you cannot change ownership without permission of Bank or clearance of loan. That Just by making a agreement relating to the ownership and payment of instalment will not solve the issue as your brother will not be having anything in his name.

questions_answered.question: Non Delivery of flat booked in sonipat global city
questions_answered.details: I have booked the flat in global city sonipat in 2013. As per agreement they suppose to give the process within 3 year but till date no clue when they will deliver the procession even after passing more than 4.5 years. I had paid arround 85% money and as per agreement if they are not able to give process within time frame than buyer can claim the refund @ 8% p.a Kindly advice
questions_answered.answer: You have several remedy open for enforcing legal right to claim possession of flat or refund of deposit amount along with interest and compensation / damages either by way of filing civil suit or Permanent Lok Adalat or consumer court . Now Government has added one more remedy under RERA Act which is faster, speedy and time bound. That complaint can be filed Before RERA in case of no Occupation Certificate is received by the builder in the said project. That every state has made regulatory authority or in the process of forming regulatory authority where you can file your application for said purpose.

questions_answered.question: What is my mother's rights on my late Father's assets
questions_answered.details: I want to know who is default owner of the property after my father's death on his self acquired property. When all the legal heirs will come into play. Can my mother decide how the property will be distributed at the moment. Does she has the right to do same and register the same in court. Also who will receive the amount of compensation if government has acquired some property by default. My father has not prepared any Will or something else. ?..
questions_answered.answer: Section 8 of Hindu Succession act, 1956 provides the list of legal heir entitled to inherit the property. That mother is certainly one of the legal heir entitled to the property. That property will be equally divided between all the legal heir namely mother, wife, children both son and daughter. However, father is excluded from class one legal heir. They will hold property jointly unless and until partition is granted by civil court. Further in case of deposit of compensation amount lying in LAC office , same needs to be distributed equally between all legal heirs stated above. That you need to record entries of death in revenue record by giving death certificate and affidavit of legal heirs for change of entries. That partition of property may be done by mutual consent by giving affidavit along with site plan either in the record of municipal authorities if in urban area or revenue record if in rural area.

questions_answered.question: Can a ancestral property be claimed by a daughter
questions_answered.details: i am hindu and my father had a ancesteral property which was transfered to him from his grand father and to grand father from his great grand father and so on.and my father died in 2012 leaving a will that all the ancesteral property shall be transfer to his son only not to his daughters which are still alive .so my question is it legal to make a will on the ancesteral property for removing the daughter share on the ancesteral property and the property has been transfered to his sons name now what can i do to get my share?
questions_answered.answer: A person holding ancestral property is not entitle to make a will as per law, will can be made for exclusive / self acquired property only. That Ancestral property have a different connotation and every coparcener has a right over the property by birth and transfer of property by virtue of will defeats the legal right of succession of all the coparcener. That this is mentioned in Hindu succession act, 1956.

questions_answered.question: How to deal with harassing husband ?
questions_answered.details: I have been married for 7 years now. Since, the marriage it was trouble. my husband is harassing me mentally. in the early phases of marriage, He used to tell me that he married me because of his mother who forced him to do so and he scolds his mother. He also said to return the thali and go back home. He also left me in the railway statement in the mid night after a fight all alone. I was pleading him not to leave me, but he left. He gets angry uncontrollably. He blames me for everything. If there is traffic jam, he blames. If kid is little cranky, he blames me. If kid supports me, he starts abusing kid also. He shows face everytime when he comes home and keeps blaming me everytime and scolds me. He threatens me saying that he will snatch the kid from me and he will leave. In case if my parents come to stop him, he will kill them. All this is increasing my tension day by day. I am staying with him only because of kid. I want to get out of this marriage. But, I want my kid also .Please help
questions_answered.answer: You can file divorce case and you can also file dowry harassment case if you want because there is a chance of arresting your husband. You can file domestic violence case and you can also claim maintenance. Don't minor kid custody first preference will be given to mother by the court. Contact us to proceed further.

questions_answered.question: Limitation to challenge registered partition deed ?
questions_answered.details: Our Family executed a Partition deed between 4 brothers in 1999.Of the 4 parts, 2 brothers were given 1 share each and the 2 shares were clubbed together and allocated to the remaining 2 brothers because one of the person was disabled and the other brother was looking after this disabled bachelor brother. Now the remaining 2 brothers are claiming 1/3 of share from the disabled brother's share since he did not execute any will to the brother who looked after him. The case has been filed after 12 years the partition was executed. can registered partition deed be challenged ?
questions_answered.answer: As you have mentioned it is family property your disabled brother will also get his right in the property with siblings and hence no one can grab it without his consent and he has to decide to dispose his right through his wish. As there is a misunderstanding about the partition that can be challenged whomever who is aggrieved among you by making your disabled brother as a party at civil court. Usually civil suits have 30 years time limitation. As there is a illegality you can challenge the partition deed  as it came to your knowledge now or depending upon the recent developments by explaining the same to court. Consult any advocate.

questions_answered.question: I have a query regarding Sale deed and car parking, can builder sell parking, What are my option ?
questions_answered.details: I booked a ready to move in flat. The builder included 3 lacs for car parking in cost sheet. I agreed to that. He sent me a draft copy of sale deed on which he mentioned the car parking number along with house details. After I gave him the first 20 percent check for first installment he provided me the modified sale deed on which the car parking not mentioned in sale deed. He also got 0.1 percent for franking charges. Kindly advice me whether the car parking details should be mentioned in sale deed or not? Still I have not signed the sale deed.Kindly let me know whether the builder can complete the franking formalities without my signature in sale deed. Thank you.
questions_answered.answer: Discuss with him about the change of agreed clause if he doesn't accept or replies in vague manner then cancel the purchase as you have not signed on the sale deed there is nothing to worry because you have to be present at Sub Registrar office while entering into an sale deed with your signature. As I mentioned if you don't get proper solution the issue a legal notice by cancelling the sale transaction with him, If you have entered into an sale agreement then go through the clause and conditions of the same and find out whether the act of builder comes under violation of the agreement even otherwise he has to comply as he has taken Rs.3 Lakh by mentioning in the cost sheet. Without your signature franking done on any document is not valid. Hence Contact advocate after cautioning the builder about his unlawful act.

questions_answered.question: What is the procedure to revoke a gift deed of property once it is made? Can a gift deed be revoked?
questions_answered.details: My wife has gifted a property to her sister through a gift deed just 10 days ago. Now, she wants to take back that property. On what grounds can she fight the case, and please tell us, can a gift deed be revoked? Specifically, can a gift deed be revoked, and how can a gift deed be revoked?
questions_answered.answer: If the Gift deed is registered then your wife has to file a civil suit before the jurisdictional city civil court for revocation of gift. It cannot be done through Sub Registrar Court. So contact any advocate if it is an registered deed to revoke the same before court

questions_answered.question: Ex girlfriend threatening to kill herself and blackmailing me
questions_answered.details: I was in a relationship with a girl and we brokeup. Now I am getting married but the girl is threatening me of defamation and that she will commit suicide. She doesn't want to marry me but only creating an issue. She has mental issues and I have sufficient proofs of it. The only problem is she has pictures of a fight with me (only she is visible) where she was both of us were injured. But only her injuries are there in the pictures. She is blackmailing for more than a year. I have call records which prove that she is threatening falsely. She has already started defaming me on social media by messaging relatives. what to do if someone is blackmailing you? Should I apply for anticipatory bail? What will be the consequences if I do so?
questions_answered.answer: You file a complaint against her for threatening and defaming in social networks on her first. If you think she is going to file any case the procure all the said documents as evidence then you can take anticipatory bail and fight the case to prove your innocence.

name: Advocate Wg Cdr Ajit Kakkar (Retd)
about: Advocate Ajit Kakkar is a Military Law & Service Law Consultant, Specialist in Service Matters, Military Law, Courts-Martial, Military Service litigation and matrimonial Issues. As a Military Advocate dealing with Army Law, Navy Law and Air Force Law, he had taken Premature Retirement from Air Force in 2012 and his last appointment was Joint Judge Advocate General (Air).

Advocate Kakkar deals in Army, Air Force, and Navy court cases Legal Advisor in BSF, CRPF, and CISF matters. He takes up litigation matters related to Service Pension, Disability pension, Promotion, Discharge, Extension of Service etc. As a Military Lawyer at the Armed Forces Tribunal, he is dealing with Army Law, Navy Law, and Air Force Law. As a service matter expert, he deals with all issues related to The Central Civil Service (Classification, Control and Appeal) Rules 1965, CCS-CCA-Rules-1965. He has been handling matrimonial issues while in service and continued taking up matters in civil courts as well on all kinds of matrimonial issues

Advocate Kakkar has also specialized in International Trade laws, he had obtained one-year Diploma from ILI New Delhi and effectively dealing with arbitration matters and other issues relating to trade laws.

Advocate Kakkar has 18 years of Experience of practice, 12 years as a Judge Advocate in the Air Force and 6 years as an advocate in Civil Courts. He has conducted various Courts-Martial as a Judge, advocate as well as a Defense Counsel. He takes up all kinds of Military matters of Promotion, Releases, Discharges, Postings, Dismissals, Pension, Maintenance Allowances, Recoveries, Awards, Administrative Action etc.
Advocate Kakkar is practicing as an Advocate at Supreme Court, High Court of Delhi, Central Administrative Tribunal & the Armed Forces Tribunals.

He is a National level sports person and participated in International Sports events, He was Director in Common Wealth Games, New Delhi (2010), Military World Games (2007) South Asian Federation Games Dhaka and Partile Cup Sweden. He has also done MBA in Sports Management and doing research in Sports Law.
He had enrolled with the Bar Council of Delhi in 2012. He is a member of the AFT Bar Association and the Delhi High Court Bar association.
Enrolment Number: D/3842/2012.
specialization: Salary Delay / Non payment of Salary / Dues

questions_answered.question: Can I resign from Indian air force?
questions_answered.details: Sir, I am currently serving in the Indian Air Force, having completed 4 years of service. I wish to resign due to personal reasons. However, as per Air Force regulations, there is a minimum service requirement of 20 years, can I resign from Indian air force?
questions_answered.answer: Hi, your case is peculiar and out of the policy of Air Force, you may like to take consultation from us, personal meeting or telephonic. Your query can not be replied in public . you have to make out some grounds as per AFO Regds

questions_answered.question: Do you have to declare marital status  in government application ?
questions_answered.details: Dear Sir, I am 24 yrs girl. i want to marry a boy but my parents are against of this. So we decided to marry in arya samaj mandir. But we want that our marriage remain confidential. As i am preparing for goverment exams so i have to fill many forms so if we do marriage is it necessary to mention there that I am married or i can fill it single?? Is hiding marital status in govt job crime? plz solve my query asap
questions_answered.answer: Hi   You are well within your rights to keep your marriage as confidential but if specific question is asked you need to reply correctly. After filling up form you are supposed to verify the form that all information given above are correct to the best of your knowledge. If you submit wrong information your form is liable to be rejected. If this information found out to be false after your appointment, your appointment is liable to be set aside. You may decide as to which action is beneficial to you, for further clarification you may call us. Regards

questions_answered.question: Action for loss of identity card & cant appear for commission exam
questions_answered.details: Sir I am a serving jco in army. Sir I lost my I card while playing a volleyball match .and got red ink entry .. sir can my red ink be written off or can it be turned down to black.. as it is stopping me to appear for commission exams..if yes how .? Plz help..
questions_answered.answer: Hi Since you lost I card while playing a volleyball match inside the campus area, you are considered on duty you can write to you CO to consider you for lesser punishment which is permitted and your case will be considered by the competent authority.Make an application without delay. All the best

questions_answered.question: Clarification regarding disability pension of personnel of AFO
questions_answered.details: sir.....they r asking for remustering and i am giving unwillingness....and as per AFO i an airwarrior is giving unwillingness for remustering then he will be discharged..... I am A4G4(P)....15-19 % disability.... Am i eligible for pension... disability pension..... ex-servicemen quota
questions_answered.answer: Hi Your case is the peculiar and borderline case, having medical Category A4G4 and disability only 15-19% is not proper but under present circumstances, we need to know more about kind of disability you are having. sometimes at the time of discharge during your release medical board if your disability is further reduced you will be further placed in a disadvantaged position. At this stage, you are at risk on this issue kindly take proper advise by sharing all the facts.All the best

questions_answered.question: Can I broadband my disability pension from 50% to 75%?
questions_answered.details: I am in receipt of 50%Disability pension. I would like to know whether I am eligible for Broadbanding to75%
questions_answered.answer: HiAll armed forces personnel drawing their disability pension are authorized to rounding off of their disability pension. Broad banding is when a person is drawing 1 to 49 % disability pension is authorized to draw 50%, a person drawing 50% to 75% is authorized to rounding off to 75% and a person drawing 76% and more is authorized to rounding off his disability to 100%. You are entitled to get your disability to be rounded of to 75% as you are drawing 50%. You need to write to your record office. Incase you find any difficulty or your record office refused to round off you may contact us. All the best

questions_answered.question: Section 138 of negotiable instrument act 1881 as ammended sec 420
questions_answered.details: She was my gf she needed money but I already hv taken loan from banks so I had no money. One day I was doing some paperwork for loan n my bank papers were on the bed she came home when she went I noticed that my one cheque is disappeared becoz I don't do transaction from check ofen so I knew I asked her she denied so I called bank n said if anyone comes just stop the check now she sent me notice that I took loan rs 45000 from her one month ago n I gave her check n just like that act 138 she has only one proof cheque I hv no proof except truth how to prove it . I hv hired a lawyer but I m very worried plz help me.
questions_answered.answer: In reply to the legal notice you should state these facts. That since there was no legal debt and liablity so you can escape from conviction by easy way. For prosecution comlainant has to show the liablity legally discharged by u.

questions_answered.question: How to get refund amount after closure of account books of the flat?
questions_answered.details: I bought a flat in resale in IRWO project Panchkula and got it duly transferred in year 2010 and even the convince deed has been done on my name in the year 2012. At the time of transfer as per IRWO transfer policies all necessary undertakings were submitted by transferor and transferee including the affidavit signed by the transferor regarding any refund which may be there after closing of account books related to this property shall be paid to the transferee. But now IRWO has send a cheque of refund amounting Rs. 30000 at my address, but cheque is on the name of first allottee/ transferor. When I insisted them to issue the refund cheque on my name, they say it's according to rules, to be returned to the transferor. Who had actually paid the full amount to IRWO initially. So, plz clarify whether, who legally should get the refund cheque now. I have CTC copies of all such undertakings and affidavits deposited at the time of transfer at IRWO office.
questions_answered.answer: That you are entitled to get the refund in case the necessary documents have been executed by the allottee in your favour. That RWA officials might be asking the no objection certificate issued in your favour by the allottee. In case of non payment you can approach the Court of Public Utility services.

questions_answered.question: Section 9 of Hindu Marriage Act
questions_answered.details: Please send me a complete deatils of section 9 . I want to file a petiton of section 9 against my wife ..whats the benifiet for section 9
questions_answered.answer: Section 9 of Hindu Marriage Act relates to restitution of conjugal rights. That in case your wife is residing separately without any sufficient cause you can file petition under Section 9 of the H.M. Act for restitution of conjugal rights.

questions_answered.question: Reduce monthly maintenance amount after mutual consent divorce
questions_answered.details: My divorce happened in May 2015, started with contested and ended up with mutual consent. My ex-wife had put all kinds of DV and Dowry cases on me and my parents in 2014, even though we were living separated since 2009. Anyways, the divorce happened in May 2015 and the monthly maintenance was settled for 55k, with an increase of 5k every alternate year, so its 60k now. Unfortunately, I do not have means to support this money, and am already in debt and am not able to pay my EMIs also to bank which I had taken for business loan (to start new work last year) and personal loan (to give her monthly maintenance). Unfortunately the new work hasnt kicked off and Im in grave financial debt. I married again in Dec 2016 and she has been supporting me financially and running the house, but kindly suggest, how can I reduce my monthly maintenance of 60k to atleast half, as the situation is very bad and its not correct to put this financial strain on my wife.
questions_answered.answer: That in case facts changed the maintenance amount can be altered. for doing so you have to approach the Court with changed circumstances but with proof what you are alleging. The court will consider the same and you will get the relief.

questions_answered.question: Mobile phone recording as evidence whether legal in India ?
questions_answered.details: Got married in dec. 2014 and wife left home dec. 2015 and now she has filed DV act ,498A crpc 125 case against me, mother & Elder Brother. After marriage she inserted memory card in mother phone and changed settings to Automatic call recording ON & started daily fighting with us with abuse language to provoke us for domestic violence but we did not do anything with her & mother shared all these things with elder brother on phone & she took those recordings and now she is planning to use those recordings in court as evidence. She did recordings upto 7-8 months without permission. Recordings like this is legal in India & can call recording be used as evidence in india? Laws to show recordings like this is illegal in India? Laws by which we can treat recordings illegal these recordings? What counter cases we can file for these illegal recordings? Kindly give legal opinion/advice. what is the supreme court judgement on call recording ? ,Highly thankful for your support.
questions_answered.answer: HiYou should take an immediate action against your wife alleging that she has defamed you and hindered your privacy by keeping a record of your call after you both were separated. Also your mother and brother can file cases for harassment and mental agony against your wife. The call recordings can be taken as evidence 8n the court if they prove something substantial related to the case

questions_answered.question: How to get 2 year old call history ?
questions_answered.details: HOW OLD CALL DETAILS CAN BE TRACED ?, CAN WE GET 2 YEARS OLD PH CALLS DETAILS OF OTHER PERSON.WHAT WILL BE PROCEDURE.
questions_answered.answer: Dear ClientThe telecom companies by the mandate imposed by TRAI cannot keep the phone call details of any person for a period preceding 3 months of now. And legally to get the phone details of other person you will have to get specific order from the court

questions_answered.question: can i get divorce without going to court in india ?
questions_answered.details: Can I give divorce without appear court proceedings ,how to apply divorce online ?
questions_answered.answer: Dear ClientYou can get contested divorce without appearing in the court. However in case you wish to apply for divorce by mutual consent then there is no way of getting divorce without appearing before the courts. You can call for further details

questions_answered.details: Hello! questions_answered.question: Procedure to follow in cheque bounce matter
questions_answered.details: 2 party ne mujhe ek ek cheque diye maal kharidne ke baste maine unko maal de diya jab maine vo cheque apne a/c me lagya to ek me stop balance aur ek me no balance se bapas a gye aur payment nahi hua.is par maine dono ko notice diya sec. 138 ke anusar 15 din se pahele ek party ka jabab a gya aur ek party ka jabab nahi aya. jiska jabab aya vo apna cheque khona bata raha h. ab mujhe kya karna hoga in dono ke khilap criminal case hoga ya civil case ya dono karne hoge. case kaise file karna h police ke ya court ke hisab se. ek cheque 150,000 aur dusra 50,000 rupees ka h court fees kitni lagegi.

questions_answered.question: Validity of general power of attorney  in court
questions_answered.details: Dear Sir / Mam I want to ask a question related to General Power of attorney. I have a house fully in my possession with electricity meter and house tax with my name. But it is on GPA. Is it valid in the court or will it be count my property if someone challenge in the legal way? and what is validity of power of attorney for property?
questions_answered.answer: Power of attorney is a authorization (adhikar patra) it's not a sale deed. Through POA you can take care and manage the related property and you can also do the related work through it but you can't b the owner through POA. property title only belongs to sale deed, will and gift transfer. So you are not the owner of this property.

questions_answered.question: What to do if someone is calling me again and again ?
questions_answered.details: A person name is troubling me by giving multiple of messages and calls. I had even warned him and not to call and give messeges. But still he calls me and texts I love you etc. It is almost 4 months now. I even scolded him and said not to give any messeges else I will report him to cyber crime. But he says I'm not doing anything wrong. I m just texting I love you. And I want to marry you. But you are doing wrong. You are scolding me. And I can also report you as you are scolding. But I will not bcoz I love you. Always he texts I love you. Whenever I warns him he says please don't decline and please don't avoid me, I love you. Sometimes he send messeges at even in mid night 4am. Sometimes he calls at 5am and disturbs me. Always I see he writes I love you, good morning etc. My mother and my cousin also warned him not to text anything. But still he text me. I am irritated. He is from puri orissa. Sir/ mam plz suggest me what to do if someone is calling again and again ? what can the police do about harassing texts ?
questions_answered.answer: kindly prepare a complaint application and file it before the police station of your jurisdiction they will initiate action against the culprit . Other option in case the local police station is not taking any action get in touch of a lawyer to guide u accordingly.

questions_answered.question: Annulment vs divorce which will be good for me i dont want a divorcee
questions_answered.details: Team i got married on 17th march 2020 pune court marraige , it was a love marriage. as marriage happened my wife went to her hometown as lockdown was gng to start till now she is in her hometown. after marriage we have never stated together as it was court marriage ,her parents said in nov once Hindu marriage happens then you stay. so no physical contact after court marriage now we were in relation for 5 months before we got married. reason i did court marriage so early i am about to o to europe so i wanted to take her with me now as sson as she got home our small fights beacem big recently she told everything at her home pl note here we had verbal spats on trust issues as she had cheated me before marriage but i forgive her  and married her now she has blocked me n family from everywhere her dad calls my home says akshay ka gussa hai and all i have not said about her anything bad at my home she has spitted venom against me in her family i was not aware about all this before i married
questions_answered.answer: No annulment or divorce can be filed unless one year is elapsed from the date of marriage .If u wish to then we have to seek special permission for filing from the court . annulment has certain grounds which cannot be applied in your case so it is better for a mutual divorce.

questions_answered.question: Rights of daughter of divorced women
questions_answered.details: If divorced is done by mutual concent using only 13b  in that if it is that father is liable to pay some amount to daughter till daughters age 18. in such cases if during this period if father refuses to give the said monthly money to daughter Then can we file any legal complaint against the father.
questions_answered.answer: daughter can seek the remedy as per sec. 125 of crpc for maintenance if the mother is unable to maintain her being a minor. plus the mother too can seek maintenance if unable to maintain herself even after the divorce.

questions_answered.question: Can a married woman live with another man without divorce ?
questions_answered.details: Can a married woman leave her husband to stay with her lover before filing for divorce? Is this legally possible under Hindu law? Is extra-marital affair legal in India?
questions_answered.answer:
Dear Concerned,

No, a married woman or married man cannot stay with another man or woman without legally ending their first marriage. Doing so is considered adultery, which was previously a punishable offense under Section 497 of the Indian Penal Code (now decriminalized but still a valid ground for divorce).

questions_answered.question: How much time does it take to get bail in IPC 326 case, and How to get bail in IPC 326 case
questions_answered.details: My friend's arrest under false IPC 326 involves two others. He's accused of using hands, while they allegedly used a stick. It's been 18 days; I seek guidance on the bail process and expected duration. How much time does it take to get bail in IPC 326 case?
questions_answered.answer: Dear Client, bail is not granted automatically. Your advocate needs to apply for the same, and the court, after reviewing the bail application, FIR, and statements, will decide on granting bail. Section 326 IPC punishment deals with causing grievous hurt by a dangerous weapon. Based on the allegations made against your friend, the court will consider bail. He can file a bail application before the Sessions Court or High Court if the magistrate denies bail. It would be advisable to consult an impaneled advocate. While going for the consultation, carry all your supportive documents to receive precise legal advice. Regards, EXPERT JURIST LLP.

questions_answered.question: Process to transfer Mhada flat to spouse name
questions_answered.details: My husband owned a MHADA flat in Mumbai. Unfortunately, he passed away last year during COVID. I am his legal heir, along with our three children, who live in different cities. I would like to transfer the MHADA flat ownership to my name. Could you please provide details on the MHADA name transfer procedure in case of death? What steps should I follow for a smooth transfer process?
questions_answered.answer:
MHADA has a structured transfer process, and transferring ownership after the death of the original owner requires proper documentation and approvals. The procedure has been made simpler with online services, but it still involves multiple steps, legal formalities, and compliance with MHADA rules and regulations for transfer of flat.

If you need assistance with the MHADA ownership transfer procedure, documentation, or legal formalities, feel free to contact us for expert guidance and a hassle-free process.

questions_answered.answer: If someone is blackmailing you, report their actions immediately to your nearest police station or the cybercrime cell. questions_answered.question: what to do if husband is not ready to give divorce in india

Is there any fast track option available to get divorce?
questions_answered.answer: MamYou can file a divorce petition under section 13 Hindu marriage act on th grounds of desertion and mental cruelty by your husband in family courts and can have divorce . This is the best ground on which u can seek divorce easily .
