questions_answered.question: In-laws not allowing to meet and stay with my parents vacation
questions_answered.details: Please let me know the rules and laws for the married women. Can she go for vacation to meet her parents as they are staying away from munbai? As everytime I want to go, they refuse to allow me and we all fight together for the same issue. My husband and mon-in-law says, now u have to think only for ur husband and his family. Please let me know the rights the  married women should have after marriage.
questions_answered.answer: getting married does not mean that you surrender all your freedom . it is  your right to go and meet your parents  and your husband cannot prevent you from  that . this may also amount to domestic violence  as they are not allowing you to go to your parents place .

questions_answered.question: Regarding registration of marriage twice with same person
questions_answered.details: Can i register my marriage twice with same person ? 1st in court and  2nd in local municipal corporation.
questions_answered.answer: Marriage is registered before the Marriage Registrar and not before the Court. Further such power of Marriage Registrar is given to the Municipal Corporation, who can register the marriage. Different states have different rules with respect to marriage registration,  therefore I need to know which state you belong,  to  so that  I can guide you further.

questions_answered.question: False 498a/DV/Maintenance Case By Fraud Wife & In-Laws
questions_answered.details: BACKGROUND : Met the girl though matrimonial site. My brother married her in her own state where she lives. After 30 days, she fled with all the jewelry (her own and the ones we gave her). Filed a false 498a/DV/Maintenance case in her state.All allegations in her complaint are the general trash (physical/mental torture, physical/verbal/mental abuse, etc.) & vague, no date, day etc.CASE STATUS :- Maintenance : Rejoinder-DV : Appearance-498a : InvestigationQUESTIONSQ1) Can we get exemption from physical attendance due to long distance, including my brother? Their city is 1200kms away from our city.Q2) We have CCTV footage of her fleeing the house with all her luggage (1 suitcase, 1 bag, 1 handbag, she is also wearing all her jewelry) when we were not present. Also, full day footage of her when she lived with us. We have CCTV everywhere except the bedroom and toilet. Can we use this & free ourselves from this wretched woman & can we quash on the false cases based on CCTV footage ?
questions_answered.answer: You can file a police complaint that she has stolen and fled with all jewellery and valuables.  you have not mentioned whether or not the FIR has been registered u/s 498A, and whether the same was submitted for counselling before Family welfare cell or some thing of the sort. In case if the FIR is registered need to take ABA and also based on the facts go for quashing the FIR. You need not attend all the dates of hearing and your Advocate may seek exemption on some dates.You will have to file for divorce to get rid of her.

questions_answered.question: Domestic violenece,bigamy dowry demand,second marriage
questions_answered.details: 1.If person performs second marriage with all ceremonies, without taking lawful divorce from first wife and hiding the fact of his first marriage can be punishable under bigamy?2.What about second wife and all other relatives who attends the marriage?3.Whether they are also punishable same as the husband?
questions_answered.answer: They can also be indicted if they were aware of the true facts and in spite of that and in furtherance of the said offence they took part in the same. The said offence of Bigamy is punishable upto 7 years of imprisonment u/s 494 of IPC.

questions_answered.question: I am a Hindu with wife three daughters and a son.
questions_answered.details: My daughters are married and well provided.I want to bequeath my properties to my wife and on her death to my son.Is it possible
questions_answered.answer: Dear ClientYes life interest in your self acquired properties can be given to your wife.   and on her death the same can be bequeathed to your son. Are the properties your self acquired or ancestral.

questions_answered.question: File a divorce without presenting the court
questions_answered.details: Want to file divorce without present ,as I am out of India ,if possible ,not possible then in witch IPC  act
questions_answered.answer: You can file for Divorce by giving your Special Power of Attorney to a friend, relative or advocate who can file the petition and sign the statement on your behalf and you can attend the proceedings through Video Call.

questions_answered.question: IF COURT SEND DIVORCE  FILE DOCUEMNTS TO WIFE IN COURT NOTICE LETTER
questions_answered.details: IF COURT SEND LETTER TO WIFE DIVORCE AND WIFE NOT RESPNSE  ANY ANSWER FOR COURT NOTICE DIVORCE CAN COURT GIVE ME DIVORCE OR HOW MUCH TIME TAKE DIVORCE
questions_answered.answer: If the wife doesn’t appear before the court even after receiving summons from the court then the case can be proceeded ex-Parte. In such situations, the disposal of the case can take up to 2 years. It is to be noted that the wife can file an application for setting aside the ex-parte order

questions_answered.question: Total fees cost for mutual divorce
questions_answered.details: Please tell me the process and total fees and cost for court, paperwork for mutual consent divorce
questions_answered.answer: When both the parties agree for divorce on mutual terms and conditions, they can file a joint divorce petition under Section 13B of the Hindu Marriage act before the Family Court of the competent jurisdiction.

questions_answered.question: Looking For Lawyers Expert In Gurgaon On Divorce Mattters
questions_answered.details: Hi , looking for divorvce experts in Gurgaon , please whatsapp. Kindly ping on whatsapp for further discussions
questions_answered.answer: In case you want to file for a contested divorce then you will first have to analyse the grounds for divorce and then you will have to proceed with the filing. In case of mutual consent divorce, the time taken is 6 months and the process is much simple and smooth. If your wife is not staying in Gurgaon then you will have to ensure that you file the case in proper jurisdiction.

questions_answered.question: Divorce I have to file divorce and need it's information
questions_answered.details: Divorce I have query about divorce I have to file it

In case of contested divorce, you will have to first analyse the grounds for divorce and then proceed accordingly.

name: Advocate Chitra Bhanu Gupta
about: Advocate Chitra Bhanu Gupta has been enrolled in the year 2004 and is having more than 15 years of experience in both Corporate and Government Organisation.

Presently practicing as an Advocate / Private Attorney / Consultant, Litigation Expert at the Hon’ble High Court, Calcutta and various District Courts, Tribunals such as Land Administrative Tribunals, Central and State Administrative Tribunals and Forums including the Consumer Forums. Dealing with matters relating to Civil, Criminal, Corporate, Arbitration Land and Real Estate and Finance Recovery Matters.

His present Clientele Includes Multinational Giants such as Landmark Cars (Mercedes Benz India Ltd) and SAN Infrastructure Ltd. He is looking after the cases pertaining to the entire Kolkata and surrounding region with regards to Landmark Cars (Mercedes Benz India Ltd) and has been assisting the corporation with his legal ideas and decisions.

Apart from this he is also attached as Empanelled Lawyer at Several Banks and Financial Institutions such as Canara Bank, HDFC Bank Ltd and Uttarbanga Kshetriya Gramin Bank dealing with recovery matters and target oriented litigations.

Mr. Gupta is also associated with several diversified project sectors such as Sova Solar Limited dealing in the Power Generation Sector and is a constant empanelled lawyer of the West Bengal State Electricity Development Corporation Ltd. To name a few.
He is presently the legal advisor of Duranto Footwear Industries Ltd and deals mostly in the recovery issues of the company.

Advocate Gupta has also Represented the Company Pt. Bina Insan Sukses Mandiri in International Dispute at Jakarta, Indonesia with regards to Multi Million Dollars Coal Dispute in connection with the company by appearing at the Jakarta Law Firms at Indonesia.

He has even Acted as the Legal Advisor of SPML Infrastructure Limited dealing mainly with Arbitration Matters, and Infrastructure related Legal Issues of the Company. Dealt with many big Ticket State Level Projects including the Arbitration Proceeding relating to a Sensitive project of 31 Crore Bank Guarantee Invocation by National Thermal Power Corporation and other arbitration proceeding relating to recovery of amounts from West Bengal Power Development Corporation Limited and also  relating to Recovery of 20 Crore money from Arunachal Pradesh Department of Power in relation with Major Hydro Electricity Power Plants.

In his early years he has been associated with the Government Legal Sector at West Bengal Industrial Development Corporation thereby handling several sensitive Government Projects dealing with many big-Ticket State Level Projects. He has recently successfully settled a case pertaining to a motor giant Maruti Suzuki India Ltd. Before the National Consumer Commission at New Delhi.

Advocate Gupta has obtained his graduate degree from the University of Calcutta. Besides this, he also holds a Post Graduate Degree in International Business Laws and a Certificate in Computer Application.
Mr. Gupta holds wide experience and expertise in dealing with matters including
•	Land and Real Estate Litigations including the litigations before the West Bengal Land Reforms and Tenancy Tribunals.

•	Property Related Legal Assistance Including the conducting of searches before the Various Registry Offices, BL & LRO and to the District Level, providing reports and conducting Registrations of properties.
•	Matrimonial Disputes and Divorce related Cases
•	Cheque Dishonor Recovery through Litigation.
•	Insurance Related Matters and recovery of Insurance related Claim cases such as Mediclaim, or Personal Accident Claim cases and other matters relating to the settlement of Insurance claims.

•	Consumer Forum Matters relating to the settlement of consumer disputes and redressal of grievances and settlement of claims arising thereof on District Forum, State Commission and National Commission. Recovery of dues.
•	Arbitration Matters, mediation and assisting in out of court settlement.
•	Financial Litigations and DRT Matters under the SARFAESI Act and SFC Act.
•	Various Court Litigations & Pleadings

Advocate Gupta has a wide experience in appearing before various tribunal and is a well known seasoned advocate before Hon’ble High Court, Calcutta and other Tribunals such as Land Reforms And Tenancy Tribunals and The State Administrative Tribunals. He is a regular in the District Courts in and around the state of West Bengal and also deals in Consumer Forums and other forums.

Outside his home state, he is a regular advocate who has already dealt with cases at the Delhi High Court, Gurgaon Courts and other Courts of the country at Guwahati (Asssam), Hyderabad and many more.
Advocate Chitra enrolled with the Bar Council of India (West Bengal) in 2004. He is a member of Calcutta High Court Bar Association and High Court Club.
courts: District Consumer Disputes Redressal Forum Howrah

questions_answered.question: How to fast track divorce by mutual consent ?
questions_answered.details: sister was forced to marriage a guy she loved 2 years ago and they registerd their marriage in panchayat without permission from us. but she never leaved with him and now both are ready to mutually divorce their relation so please tell me  what is the mutual divorce procedure ?,how long will it take? are their any easy ways? Please tell us how to get divorce fast?
questions_answered.answer: There is no easy way out for you other than to get a decree of divorce from a family court of competent jurisdiction. It can take for a period of 6-8 months after filing of the petition for divorce. Even for the matter of a remarriage in future, people stress on decree of divorce. So the same is inevitable for her for a better future. Anything further, you can contact me

questions_answered.question: Can rape case be filed after many years had passed in India?
questions_answered.details: Could a woman be able to file a rape case in India even after so many years of the incident in India?
questions_answered.answer: The recent incidents makes police to have a rethought and insists on a preliminary investigation into the merits of the case in such matters where there is delay. Theoretically issue of delay is not applicable to file a cognizable offence like rape, though delay in lodging FIR is a ground of defence for the accused..

questions_answered.question: Can impotentcy can be ground for divorce in India?
questions_answered.details: My wife and her parents are trying to sue me, claiming I am impotent. I personally do not have any health issues, but I didn't undergo any medical check-up prior to marriage. We have not had sexual intercourse in the last four months. After our engagement, we faced several issues with them and tried to cancel the marriage, but they didn't allow it. Now, if I am tested positive for impotency, what will be my fate? My parents insisted on the marriage, and that's all I have done. I come from a poor family but have a good job, while my wife is from an upper-middle-class background. She is asking for a divorce. Our marriage is now four months old. Please give me suggestions. Both of us are Hindus, and the claim of impotency is being used as a ground for divorce.
questions_answered.answer: Your wife can sue for divorce on the basis of impotency. But if you object to it in the court of law, they have to prove it by taking steps. For that you may need to undergo medical examination. If the impotency is proved then the divorce can be allowed. But impotency is of several reasons. Physical impotency is to be proved. A person may suffer from impotency due to mental elements; and that is temporary which can be cured. In that case we can stick on.

questions_answered.question: Vacation Club Is Not Delivering Services
questions_answered.details: I paid to vacation club but now vacation club is not arranging facilities as club offered...... not even from online or not even from call to excutive
questions_answered.answer: It’s a deficiency of service and can be sued before the consumer court… there is proper scope that if filed and contested even compensation can be awarded… so you can darely proceed with legal measures

questions_answered.question: My Husband Need Me to Give Divorce
questions_answered.details: My Husband Need me to give him divorce . He has my son with him and not allowing to see my son or talk with him . Iam ready to give divorce but i need my son to be with me . He is doing all this to give me divorce and he dont want to pay any maintenance . he dont love my son he is using them for negotiation . What do you suggest i do ?
questions_answered.answer: In fact the matter requires detailed discussion..we need to get the child through other legal sources, then approach the court in such a way that the custody of the child will remain with you .. there are provisions for that. Further if he files for divorce in between you need to contest it till the custody becomes clear … once the custody becomes safe, we can file to get maintenance too

questions_answered.question: Boundaries mismatch in encumbrance certificate
questions_answered.details: Hai sir recently I purchased open plot at ghatkesar I paid 80% of total amount remaining balance agree to pay after completion of lrs but boundaries mismatch in EC. pls suggest me how can I solve this issue.
questions_answered.answer: Dear Sir,If you have not registered the plot then you can rectify the boundaries after verification of site area. If you have registered the plot then you have to rectify by registering the rectification deed.

questions_answered.question: Difference in Survey no of title and plot area
questions_answered.details: The Developer D developed a layout with 1 to 70 plots in 3 sy nos 72,72A,102A in 2006 wit total area of 21780 Sq yards. In 2007 he has registered Sale agreement with possession in respect of sy.o72 in favour of Mr X (3509 sy yards) and the balance in favour of Mr Y.I have purchased 200 Sq yards in 2009 from Mr X where he has got absolute GPA in Sy no 72 and got registered document stating that  200 yards in sy.o 72 with plot no 69 with their boundaries as per the layout. Because there are 70 plots I have not suspected any wrong in that. In 2015 the Developer has expired. After expiry of the Developer the other GPA Holder Mr Y executed the sale deeds in favour of himself and got registered the area in Sy.No 72A and 102A.Recently I have fenced my plot No 69 with barbed wire fencing. Recently I came to know that my plot is in sy.o 102A and not in 72 as per the deed. Mr Y has sold the area in 72A,102A to Mr Z in 2016 and he has removed my fencing. Please advise me In this
questions_answered.answer: Dear Sir,As per your information mentioned above it can be ascertained that your AGPA holder has sold you the plot but another AGPA holder has sold your plot, let me check with your documents for proper legal advice. As per your information, you can file a civil for cancellation of sale deed and criminal case for cheating & criminal misappropriation against Y in court of law. For further discussion you can avail our legal services.

questions_answered.question: Partition deed executed without partitioning the actual property
questions_answered.details: Hii,A single house which is around 45 years old has been subjected to registered partition deed among two brothers and the house is joint property and is not physically divided or partitioned. . Elder brother was not living in his share of property for long and younger brother has been living in the property till now.Now elder brother without informing or checking with younger brother has sold his share to third party. The third party is now coming and threatening the younger brother who is living with family  that they would demolish and take their portion of the house.The house being very old has the danger that if any portion of house is subjected to demolition the whole house can collapse .What is the legal remedy the younger brother can take in this regard to protect his intrest and  share of the property.
questions_answered.answer: Dear Client,The younger brother can get orders from court against the third party for not to demolish the house without due process of law. The younger brother has to issue legal notice to third party purchaser regarding this.

questions_answered.question: Buying property from AGPA holder
questions_answered.details: Hi Sir,I shortlisted a residential land in hyderabad.My sellers seller is APGA holder.Will it be a problem if i buy it.RegardsNayeem
questions_answered.answer: Dear Nayeem,You can buy a residential land through AGPA holder if the document is registered and proper stamp duty is paid and AGPA holder is authorised to execute sale by GPA powers. We need to verify the document to provide legal advice.

questions_answered.question: Buying plot from registered gpa holder
questions_answered.details: I am planning to buy a plot in Hyderabad,owner reside aboard and given gpa to this father in law ,gpa holder has orginal sale deed and gpa document full paid stamp duty and registration charges .can I go ahead and buy the plot what are complication? I am planning to register on my name with sale deed complete registration fee and stamp duty from sub registrar office
questions_answered.answer: Dear Sir,You can buy the plot accordingly. An NRI can sell the residential plot in India but not agricultural land except where the same is acquired through inheritance. We have to check the documents in order to give prompt response.

questions_answered.question: Can a property which is under a loan liability be donated
questions_answered.details: The property is clearer, The home loan is up to the next 14 years. Can a property be donated?
questions_answered.answer: If there is an agreement between the creditor and the borrower that the property is mortgaged against the loan provided, then no third party right/interest can be created in respect of the said property without the consent of the creditor. Donation creates third party (donee) right in the property.

questions_answered.question: Can a person be exempted from paying the bond amount
questions_answered.details: I had been working in private mnc 4 yrs back. Had signed a bond at the time of joining. I resigned after 4 months of joining due to personal issue. I also received the resignation acceptance letter from the company. Now I have got a legal notice from the company asking me to pay the bond amount since I didn’t complete the required period in the company . What should i do
questions_answered.answer: Need to study the bond paper & the legal notice.Please send these documents. Need to look into the terms and conditions mentioned in the bond paper carefully. What are the relevant clauses therein? In what circumstances you are required to pay the bond amount? Whether there are any clauses which may in some situations exempt you from such payment? Whether there is any clause which exempts you from such payment in the event your resignation is accepted? Whether such matter ought to have been settled prior to acceptance of resignation? Whether the contract between you and the said entity particularly regarding this clause is legally valid or not?.. etc. need to be examined.

questions_answered.question: Sister's husband married again without taking divorce
questions_answered.details: my sister and her husband is not living together from 7 years and now her husband got married so how can she take action
questions_answered.answer: sue him for bigamy.  under the HMA and other laws of state,  one cannot remarry without seeking divorce from first spouse.  So this will be better approach nearest family court and initiate appropriate proceedings against that person.

questions_answered.question: Relief in case of summon for cheque bounce
questions_answered.details: Hi i have been summoned by Dwarka Evening court for cheque bounce amounting 18342. I had taken a personal loan for 257000 and I have paid 33 EMI's till now, however due business loss, I shut down my business and started working in a BPO, I have also taken loan from Axis Bank and Bajaj Finance, I have settled loan with Axis bank and I am paying 8000 per mo nth to them and still have 8 months to go. My question is why the bank has sent cheque amount for 18342/- as I never signed any cheque for this amount and how do I proceed about this summon and also settle the loan as I am willing to settle the loan, however, I need sometime as I am already making payment to Axis bank. Can Bank allow me time till I clear Axis bank loan. Any help would be appreciated.
questions_answered.answer: Dear Sir/  Mdam,reference to your query,  the same is only answerable only after reading contents of legal notice and document of Bank (If any),  therefore enable us to go through and update you.Regards.

questions_answered.question: Can NBFC change EMI amount on realizing mistake in tenure of home loan
questions_answered.details: If a NBFC does mistake while calculating the Tenure of Home Loan and realizes it after 12 months can they still charger the borrower?Can they directly change the EMI amount to adjust the difference without customer consent?
questions_answered.answer: Mr/Mrs, It seems to be mistake of bank. the bank can ratify mistake, but not beyond law, rules of RBI, bank can change EMI but they have to inform you. but probably they take ur consent at the time loan application. therefore you are bound by the ur consent in loan application. if u have any grievance u can filed complaint before Ombudsman of ur concern bank for not charging any amount of mistake of bank from you.

questions_answered.question: Procedure to recover salary dues after being temporarily terminated
questions_answered.details: My employer temporarily terminated my employment on the basis of false elegation of misconduct by one of the candidate that I interviewed. They had not paid my 50 days salary before the date of temporary termination. How can I recover my salary from my employer ?
questions_answered.answer: Mr/Mrs,    Temporarily termination concept not in law. If u r permanent employee, then employer can't terminate you without an departmental enquiry.  still u terminate you, then u can filed Complaint before the Labour about termination. if you want only salary then u can file S.33-C2 application before the Labour court. or you can approach before Labour Commissioner of concern area filed same complaint since amount very less.     If you are temporary employees also then u can take same procedure as above, but for temination their employer no need of departmental enquiry,

questions_answered.question: Validity of marriage done as per Hindu ceremonies but not registered , is hindu marriage valid witho
questions_answered.details: If two Hindus are married to each other as per Hindu rites and ceremonies of either party i.e. By way of Saptpadi. But their marriage is not registered and without registration both parties went outside India. Is their marriage valid even outside India without being registered as per Hindu law ? if marriage is not registered is it valid in india ?
questions_answered.answer: Non-registration of marriage does not effect validity of the marriage. In other words, the marriage between the parties would remain valid even if it is not registered. Though your query does not spell out the context in which it is made, the parties can still get their marriage registered whenever they visit India.

questions_answered.question: How to get a copy of interrogation ordered by the court
questions_answered.details: While granting anticipatory bail if judge impose a condition to appear before police for intorogation .. then can I request for having audio and video recording of the interrogation ? If yes, then in what provision we can request the court ?
questions_answered.answer: Article 20(3) of the Constitution of India entitles an accused to his right to silence (except under certain circumstances) to protect himself against any possible self-incrimination. This is the basic jurisprudence of the fair constitutional rights all over the world and are, thus, part of the basic fundamental rights under our constitution. In criminal cases (except certain exceptions) the liability or onus to establish the guilt of the accused offender lies on the prosecution. Moreover, any statement made by the accused to the police during investigation in police custody (except in certain exceptions) are not admissible against the accused at trial. Having replied to your concerns I’ll suggest you should not jump to any conclusion(s) or commit yourself to any further action unless I get to examine the precise allegations, evaluate material and draw strategy to deal with the same. We can meet for a conference as per mutual convenience after prior scheduling. Plz bring aling all the case documents available with u. Best wishes,Gaurave BhargavaAdvocate

questions_answered.question: Legal procedure to report child abuse in India & legal action
questions_answered.details: How is non-recent child abuse reported in india and what action is taken against the victim ad the abuser.
questions_answered.answer: Depending on the kind of abuse the child is suffering, such child abuse can be reported to the Commission for Protection of Child Rights which are set-up at the State & Central level or to the police, if such child abuse also amounts to a crime under penal or special Law. Eg. Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.

questions_answered.question: Supreme Court the highest court of appeal & final judgement
questions_answered.details: We have a 14 year old case - not being able to get the tenant out of our apartment in Chennai, India. It is going from court to court on appeal and now the tenant is going to Supreme Court i New Delhi (he lost in the Chennai High Court). Any idea how long it will take to get the judgement. If the tenant loses in Supreme Court can he appeal to any other higher bench?
questions_answered.answer: A case in Supreme Court may take anywhere between 5-7 years or more to get decided if ‘Notice’ is issued in the first hearing. It is, thus, advisable to keep track of the matter through a lawyer, file caveat, if advised by the lawyer & try to get the matter dismissed/rejected in the first hearing itself. After rejected by SC, the tenant has the option of filing a review petition & curative petition in SC itself, but chances of getting relief after initial dismissal of the case are negligible.

questions_answered.question: What amount shall be recovered when police raid a house
questions_answered.details: Hi Police raided my house and they didn't find anything. During police remand they asked us to give money and they will cancel the fir against us. We paid them 15 lakh but after police remand they showed that it was recovered from our house. Now in court what shall we say. Shall we deny that it's not our money or shall we accept it and show them the proof. In chargesheet police has shown that it was recovered from the house that we have rented to someone. If I accept it what should I say that from where they recovered the money. I want to use what they have mentioned in chargesheet that they recovered from my rented house. I have rent agreement for the house.
questions_answered.answer: Facing a criminal trial is a serious business. The course to be adopted in the situation you find yourself in has to be strategised in context of allegations against you, the sections invoked against you & the defence which you have against the allegations. This can be best analysed by the lawyer conducting your trial. By seeking such advice in piece-meal manner you would only be spoiling your case. Thus, stick to your lawyers advice, or if you’re not satisfied, meet a seasoned criminal lawyer with your entire case record.

questions_answered.question: Legal remedy against cheque bounce and to recover money
questions_answered.details: Sir, From Dec'2016 to Aug'2017, my friend took a total amount of Rs.60,000/- for his personal need. I have transactions of 30,000/- shown in my bank acc. which goes directly to his bank and paytm and rest 30,000 in cash. I've given all my money from my credit card and he promises to pay with interest. On Aug'2017, he gave me a cheque of 60,000/- which was a bounce but I didn't take any actions against him on personal request and then same happened with 6,000/- check after 1 month. At last, I send a legal notice of check bounce of Rs. 1,40,000/- on 13th Dec'17. Now need to know, is there any drawback or loopholes which he can use to escape or he get easily rid of from this situation. I just want my Money!!
questions_answered.answer: Hello Dear,I did not understand how are you demanding Rs.1,40,000/- whereas, the dishonored cheque amount is Rs 60,000/-. furthermore, you have not disclosed the date of dishonor of the cheque so that i can reply to property however the law (in term of criminal proceeding) is as under ;1. the Legal demand notice must be issued within 30 days of dishonor of the cheque.2. Through the legal demand notice put a demand of money within 15 days of receiving of the notice.3. On lapse of of given period of 15 days, thereafter within 30 days you have to file the complaint before the magistrate.there is provisions that on proving the case the Accused be sentenced up to 2 years simple imprisonment and fine upto the double of the cheque amount.Apart that you can also avail civil remedy by filing a money/recovery suit under order 37 of CPC or simple money recovery suit with paying court fee as accordingly.
